sentences.en: A new tax was imposed on fuel.
sentences.cn: 当局开始对燃油征收一项新税。

sentences.en: Don't impose yourself on people who don't like you.
sentences.cn: 不要硬缠着不喜欢你的人.

sentences.en: Fractures often impose a greater need for strict immobilization.
sentences.cn: 骨折迫使病人需要有严格的固定.

sentences.en: He has tried to impose solutions to the country's problems by fiat.
sentences.cn: 他试图下令强行解决该国的问题。

sentences.en: I didn't want to impose myself on my married friends.
sentences.cn: 我不想打扰自己已婚的朋友。

sentences.en: I don't want to impose on you by staying too long.
sentences.cn: 我不想打扰你,不多耽搁了.

sentences.en: I don't want to impose on you.
sentences.cn: 我并不想打扰你.

sentences.en: Parents should beware of imposing their own tastes on their children.
sentences.cn: 父母应该提防把自己的兴趣强加给孩子。

sentences.en: Parents should beware of imposing their own tastes on their children.
sentences.cn: 父母应该提防把自己的兴趣强加给孩子。

sentences.en: parents who impose their own moral values on their children
sentences.cn: 把自己的道德观强加给孩子的父母

sentences.en: Several federal laws impose liability for oil spills.
sentences.cn: 好几部联邦法律部对石油泄漏的责任做了规定.

sentences.en: The court can impose a fine.
sentences.cn: 法庭可以强制执行罚款。

sentences.en: The courts were empowered to impose the death sentence for certain crimes.
sentences.cn: 法院有权因某些罪行判处罪犯死刑。

sentences.en: The House voted to impose a one-year moratorium on nuclear testing.
sentences.cn: 众议院投票表决将核试验暂停一年。

sentences.en: The law should impose penalties on companies that use energy wastefully.
sentences.cn: 法律应当严惩浪费能源的公司。

sentences.en: The wish to impose order upon confusion is a kind of intellectual instinct.
sentences.cn: 想在混乱中理出头绪是一种知性本能。

sentences.en: They can impose tariffs and quotes on imported items.
sentences.cn: 他们可以对进口商品征税,实行配额.

sentences.en: to impose a penalty
sentences.cn: 予以惩罚

sentences.en: We cannot impose our will upon the other 94 percent of mankind.
sentences.cn: 我们不能把我们的意志强加于其他百分之九十四的人类.

sentences.en: You shouldn't impose on his good nature.
sentences.cn: 你们不应该欺负他老实.

words.tran_cn: （建筑物等）壮观的；威风的；（仪表）堂堂的；给人深刻印象的
征收；强加；欺骗；不公平的负担
欺骗（impose的过去分词）；把…强加于

trans.tran_cn: 推行，强制实行，把…强加于，使遭受，使承受(压力、痛苦等) ，勉强（某人做某事）
trans.tran_en: if someone in authority imposes a rule, punishment, tax etc, they force people to accept it

trans.tran_cn: 利用， 占便宜； 欺骗

trans.tran_en: If you impose your opinions or beliefs on other people, you try and make people accept them as a rule or as a model to copy
